Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2014
Author: KWR
Title: Towel fell apart with first wash.
Body: I was excited to receive these, and immediately put them into the washer and then dryer before first use. Imagine my disappointment when I took the towels out of the dryer, and one had unraveled! You can see for yourself what happened in the product images. It fell apart before I could even use it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2015
Author: MariamG
Title: Pinzon in Plum, Pretty and Plush!  See Photos and Links.......
Body: ***Updated review.I purchased these towels in spite of the mixed reviews and pictures of damaged towels... One reason being the low $21.99 price point for the set of 6 towels, another being the slightly larger bath towels at 30"x 56" (standard is 27x54).Also, I read reviews stating that the plum is slightly lighter than pictured and this is what I was hoping for. I figured they were worth a risk as I noticed the reviewers who noted the plum color didn't seem to have as many negative reviews.They arrived quickly and my husband and I both agreed that they appear to be thick and beautiful. That said, I can't yet comment on quality, in terms of longevity, but will be updating this review after a few months of use and numerous washes.I am very particular about how I launder clothing and the likes, so my findings will only really apply for others who do the same... I don't wash towels with jeans or other articles with zippers or anything that could snag them (or that the towels would wear down).I use Perwoll detergent for darks which preserves and renews dark colors beautifully (sold here on Amazon, pricey but a little goes a long way and its worth it) and I don't use detergents with regular fillers which buildup on clothes.     Lastly, I use wool dryer balls and do not use fabric softener (which especially shouldn't be used with towels since it leaves a coating on them, making them less absorbent).     I uploaded some pictures so you can see the plum. I laid out a couple of purple cardigans next to them that are more of a true purple or plum, for comparison. These are a slightly smokey plum (more plum than gray, just a touch more muted shade). Very plush, especially for under $22, and much prettier than expected!Definitely recommend, at the very least, for towels on display getting little use. No snags or poor quality apprearance upon arrival - from Pinzon seller via Amazon, in Plum.Happy shopping! Smile.*UPDATE* After first wash, no more dryer lint than with any other new towel set I've purchased. No fuzzies sticking to wet skin or shedding. Color and overall look is as good as new... More to come if anything changes...After a month of use, a number of washes and dryings, we are super happy with this set!  We will be ordering another set while we can (noticed the seperates in plum are no longer available and the HUGE bath mat in plum is now also gone- very plush!).  I do recommend it though, (still available in other colors) see my review with photos here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R1ESKH88D6JLD7/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B000T2T8RKHope this helps!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2014
Author: PJD
Title: Shedding & snags galore
Body: It's a shame the driftwood sets that I bought (6) did not look as good after they were initially laundered as they did before they were washed !I'll post the pic of the lint filter from my dryer on the first drying cycle. Then I ran the load through the air only cycle for 20 minutes and again a full lint filter, then ran them again on air only for 20 min.and again a full lint filter. I was afraid at that point that if I continued to dry them I would eventually end up with a nothing load !Snags: every item had between 12 & 16 snags after laundering. More on the bath towels and hand towels. Several so bad that the backing of the towel is thread bare. Will post pics. There is no excuse for this !I have not used them so I can't speak to durability, but I do know that my other Egyptian towels from Walmart and Overstock.com did not shed and shag like these towels have done. I think it's just a case of "you get what you pay for" and in this case, it's NOT MUCH....Won't order again and won't use for guests.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2018
Author: Noah's Ark
Title: Only 30% Egyptian Cotton and less than 400 GSM in weight. Not worth the price, not quality towels.
Body: This review is for the Wedgewood  blue towel set. The towel color matches the photos but they are  very thin and extremely inferior in texture, and feel. They might be OK for use by Motel 6, but not by any quality hotels.Though they are 100% cotton, their label states they are only 30% Egyptian Cotton. They have a rough texture. Their GSM weight is not stated on the label but the webpage description for the Gray towel states they are 725 GSM. 725 GSM would be very acceptable for a thick luxury-hotel  towel. But these blue towels are so light and thin that they must be less than 450 or even 400 GSM.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2018
Author: JLM
Title: Cheaper, Thinner, than before. Shame.
Body: I bought these Pinzon towels several years ago and needed some new ones. These are nowhere near the quality of the prior version. They are lighter, thinner, and even the label is a cheap plastic label rather than a fabric label. Very disappointed that the quality has been compromised. I don't understand when you have a great product, does every new product manager have to justify their existence by making it cheaper? I mean, yes, you make more money, but isn't the whole point of having a great product is that it remains great? Who are these people who make these decisions to cheapen products. Constant cheapening means we go elsewhere to find someone who makes decent products. Shame.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2016
Author: Grandma Zizzy
Title: Really liked these... until the washcloths started getting splotches all over them!
Body: 2/3/17 update:  For our whole adult lives, both my husband and I have had to pinch pennies, so we're hardly what you'd call "towel snobs"... we had our two sets of "good towels" which were used only for company (and to dry off our grandkids during sleepovers - they're the most important "company" in our lives!), and then there were the towels we ourselves use... and have been using for eons!  But this year, I decided to splurge a bit in that area for my hard-working, blue collar hubby, googled "Egyptian cotton towels" (since I'd heard Egyptian cotton was the creme de la creme, with its longer, more dense threads/thread loops that pull moisture away from your body while trapping the warmth of that moisture at the same time) and this set of Pinzon towels popped up.  Seemed a pretty decent price for quality, so I went ahead and ordered a couple of sets for him - he's a big guy, and was thrilled to have these generously sized towels after a long day!  He could not care less about such things, but I loved the border designing.First, I wish I'd done a little more research before making the purchase.  Had NO idea that Amazon had started its own private label lines years ago, including this Pinzon label (bed & bath, table top kitchen tools/accessories, indoor furnishings)!  The others are Strathwood (outdoor furnishings/lighting), Pike Street (a "value" line of bed/bath), and Denali (tools/accessories), and apparently they made the move to try to give its customers great value at competitive prices.  I knew the GSM (grams per square meter) number was important when looking at towels (i.e. 300-400 are pretty thin/light weight, 400-600 are considered medium weight/thickness, while 600-900 are the super absorbent, thick and heavy feeling towels that you typically find in upscale hotels or spas.)  Since we don't often (NEVER!) frequent those types of places, I was pretty happy when I saw the 600 GSM number on these towels.  When I went to write my review, I happened to see Pinzon's LUXURY towels - an 820 GSM for not too much more!  Another thing to keep in mind when buying Egyptian towels is to make sure the label doesn't say "made with" Egyptian cotton... they also contain standard cotton and sometimes even polyester!  The label should say 100% Egyptian cotton - these do.  And I guess the other thing is that while Egyptian IS the "cadillac", Pima cotton is grown in America and creates a towel similar in GSM to Egyptian, and Turkish cotton is also a quality cotton - again, the key with all three (Egyptian, Pima or Turkish) is making sure it says "100%".I washed them a couple of times before using to get rid of the chemical smell and - while there was quite a bit of lint the first time around, there wasn't as much the second, and they certainly weren't falling apart as I'd read about in some of the other reviews.  HOWEVER... after my husband began using them, I started noticing white splotches on the wash cloths as I'd also read about in other reviews (though NOT on the hand or bath towels.)  We're now close to 2 months into use, with the wash cloths splotched all over the place but no splotches at all on the hand or bath towels!  As I was folding laundry yesterday and shaking my head over the splotches, it finally hit me.  My husband uses an astringent to clean his face of work grime when he gets home from work, using the wash cloths, so I believe it's one of the ingredients in the astringent that's reacting with the dye in the hand cloth!  Depending upon the type of soap/cleanser or laundry detergent other reviewers are using, I'm betting it could be a similar reaction.  But I'll tell ya - NONE of our old wash cloths reacted this way to his astringent, so whatever dyes they're using in the Pinzon plants much be pretty cheap.  Amazon's attempt to to give its customers "great value at competitive prices" should not mean taking shortcuts that don't allow a product to perform under typical usage!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
Author: Faith
Title: Thin and rough to the touch
Body: The color is a true depiction, but I donated this entire set to the animal shelter upon arrival.  The label said 100 % Cotton and nothing else. No more details.  I honestly feel that this is a dollar store quality product and could not possibly sustain one cycle in a washer or dryer.  Strangely, I also ordered the aqua at the same time which was by the same brand but more expensive, and there was no contest between the two.  The gray I have to strongly recommend against.  It’s simply cheap and poorly made.  The aqua was absolutely satisfactory and what I was expecting.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2016
Author: Anna Harper
Title: Cheap Disposable Towels, Into The Landfill They Go
Body: This is one of the worst purchase I have ever made here on Amazon. In a word, this product is garbage. It truly is. If I could give this towel set no stars I sure would. I feel like I just flushed my money down the proverbial toilet, but what I am really upset about is the waste of resources. Recycling is very important to me. I guess I can use them for rags or for my own use when I don't have guests around, but not for guest towels like I wanted to.I have bought Pinzon products in the past and enjoyed a certain level of quality. I read the reviews and they were mixed. So, I decided to give them a try, based on my past experiences with the Pinzon name. I thought that maybe they just got one bad towel. I will never buy Pinzon products again.For the cost the thickness and quality of the product appeared to good when I opened the package, little did I know that the towels had hidden issues I wouldn't see until later.These towels are one time use, they are just disposable and will fill a landfill somewhere. After one use and washing they are fading in small areas, turning orange. Clearly they not color fast. You can see the color fading in the photo. I used one set and washed it, every single one had the same issue. And I know that it isn't from leftover bleach from a previous wash or anything like that. I never use bleach, it very harsh on fabrics and shortens the life of  your clothing.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
Author: donna s
Title: Quality
Body: Changed my mind. While these are absorbant and longer than standard towels....the will not stop pilling even after 6 washings. It looks like it "snowed" in my bathroom and hair with each use. Will cut into cleaning rags.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2018
Author: JEK
Title: Poor dye quality???
Body: I just got this towel set no more than two weeks ago. I swear my hands were clean and all I did was wash it thoroughly with soap before I wiped my hands on the towel, but it continues to change the color permanently to this ugly orange. I washed the towels a couple of times, but it is permanently damaged. It seems to me that the dye is super poor quality. It should not change color when just wiping hands from having washed them with soap. Even if it gets a little bit of soap leftover on it, quality dye would not turn color instantly. Yes, the color turns instantly as you wipe your hands. I am very disappointed since I do personally love the original color tone a lot... just wish it was more quality.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017
Author: Paula Tom
Title: Really happy with them.
Body: Thick and soft towels. Really happy with them. I washed them like another reviewer said, by washing on the hot water setting and then drying only with the dryer balls. But I already use dryer balls anyway. If you don't have them, I highly recommend them. Dryer sheets would leave a residue, especially if you dried them on high heat. I dried them on medium heat and they came out beautifully soft and full. Not even too much fuzz in the lint catcher. Just about as much as you would expect.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019
Author: Oakspear
Title: Great Towels for the Money
Body: I had been needing some new towels for a while. When I saw these towels on Amazon for a low price I was excited at first, but then I started reading the mixed reviews, which gave me pause. However, I decided to go ahead and give them a try anyway, and I'm glad I did so.These towels are soft to the touch, look great, and are very absorbent. They've held up well through multiple washings and I have yet to see any fading except for a couple of the hand towels (Which was expected; I'll come back to that later).After reading some of the other reviews, I noticed that a lot of people are upset with the amount of shedding from these towels. Here's the deal: Almost all towels are going to shed through the first few washings. I've had cheap towels from Wal-Mart and premium ones from Bed, Bath, & Beyond, and one thing they ALL had in common was that they shed like crazy through the first half-dozen or so washings. It just comes with the territory. Shedding doesn't mean that the towels are of poor quality; it's just something that towels do (in fact, I'd be worried about the long-term durability of towels that DON'T shed at first).Now, about the hand towels I mentioned earlier. I set aside a couple of the hand towels to use with my Proactiv acne treatments. Proactiv (and any other acne treatment that contains benzol peroxide) is going to make your clothes and towels fade. For that reason, I made it a point to buy a couple of extra hand towels and use them just for drying my face after I apply my treatment, as I knew they would probably fade badly as a result (and they did). The same has happened to every other set of towels I've owned, so I don't hold it against the towels themselves; it's just the effect that benzol peroxide has on fabric.Overall, I've very please with the quality of these towels. Another good bargain from Amazon.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2015
Author: anita hardesty
Title: Very DIsappointed- See picture attached
Body: I was very excited when I first received the towel set. Beautiful rich color, nice big towels. Not only the bath towel was large size but the wash cloths and hand towels to. I washed these towels and went to get them out of my dryer and my dryer vent in overfilled of lint.  I wish I could attach a picture of how much lint came off these towels. I washed only the towels nothing else with them.The towels do not look brand new anymore and this is after one wash. They look the same as my old towels. Very disappointed. I was so happy when I first received them I was planning on buying 4 more sets. I don't want to buy anymore when the towels look the same as my old ones after one wash. Remember the picture attached is after just one wash and dry. The lint was unbelievable, like nothing I have ever seen before. :(

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2015
Author: Dan Skinner
Title: Lots, and lots, and lots of lint
Body: Got these towels after I purchased a much more expensive set, and was thoroughly disappointed.These towels were actually softer than the 900gm cotton towel set I recently returned to Amazon.I purchased the towels in a Wedgewood color, and they arrived looking just like they were advertised (sometimes the colors tend to be off).  I immediately washed them, and when I pulled them from my washer, the inside of the washer was FILLED with wet lint (had to run a cycle to clean it).  Then into the dryer they went.  So much lint came off the towels that it was more than my dryer filter could handle.  I pulled the lint off and had larger than a facecloth size of towel remnants in my hand.  The lint was thicker than a roll of Scotch Tape, and longer than a soda bottle (see pictures).The good news is that, even after shedding more than a Siberian Husky in the Mojave Desert at Noontime in June, the towels look great.  They feel quite soft, and, after having been used the for the first time, are quite absorbent.I'd recommend these towels to anyone looking for a soft, absorbent set of true-to-color, bath set.  My advice, wash them by themselves, and when drying them, either use a clothes line, or clean the dryer lint-trap halfway through the cycle.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2015
Author: Kipsydoodle
Title: If You Like Lint, These Are The Towels For You
Body: Oh brother. I never thought to read reviews of towels but I kind of regret that now. I did look at the stars which showed an average of 4 and while that might make me do further research for other kinds of products, it seemed acceptable for towels. Of course I pre-washed them before use and was amazed at the stunning amount of lint. First I washed them with some other towels. Those towels had so much lint stuck to them I had to wash and dry them again separately. I then rewashed and re-dried the Pinzon towels and wound up with another totally full lint filter (see photo 1). When I took the towels out of the dryer the 2nd time an abundance of fine 'towel dust' began to fall off the towels so I decided to wash and dry them again. I carefully put them back in the washer so I wouldn't have a layer of towel dust all over my kitchen. I washed them - without detergent of any kind - and dried them again. This time it looked as though the lint had been tackled, there was only ½ a filter full of lint (see photo 2). I had no problem with the towels unraveling but this time one of the hand towels had spots where the color came out of the towel (see photo 3). This towel will be used as a rag. Also, by this time the once soft towels felt coarse and uninviting. I decided to use the bath towel for my next shower to see if it was okay to use. It was indeed very scratchy. I'm going to try to bring back some of the softness with dryer sheets but if that doesn't work I will have at the end of this ridiculous process a $22 set of rags. It's a shame too, such a waste of cotton.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
Author: Gary J. Hernandez
Title: Disappointing
Body: This is a wonderfully thick luxurious towel with one exception. The seams are starting to unravel. Very disappointing as I really like them. This is a simple stitch to have them come apart. I’m going to return them.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Scratchy, dry, thin, not worth it
Body: Scratchy, dry fabric, not soft at all. They were significantly more expensive than the Amazon Basics brand, so I would have expected higher quality. I wish I had saved my money and gotten the cheaper ones. I can't imagine they would be much worse than these.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2014
Author: KT
Title: DO NOT BUY THESE
Body: These were a big disappointment.  The size is good.  But I had to get out my sewing machine and cut and stitch the bath towels after the first wash (before anyone even used them).  This is a lesson in 'you get what you paid for' I guess.  Amazon, I would suggest you go after this supplier and either tell them to improve their product or pull it from the market.  Not to mention that because I ordered 2 sets of towels I should have received 4 face cloths.  Amazon credited my account.  I didn't want to return the towels.  We need them.I hope they last until August when the white sale hits

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2014
Author: Nicole
Title: Wanted to love them...but sadly....
Body: At first glance, they are thick enough, not too super thick that they can't dry quickly. Very soft, plenty big enough. (the bath towel is a nice size) Can't speak to color, I bought the pure white. But then I washed the towel, after ONE wash, exactly ONE wash....a hole. About the size of a half dollar, on the edge of the towel inside the hem. I will try to add a picture, if it weren't for the hole, I would say this is a nice set for the price, I will see what happens with the other pieces, but will likely return them because I bought two sets.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2016
Author: Thom
Title: Slick is not what I like.
Body: After about two months, I will give this towel set a 3. It would have been a 2, but then I considered the price. First, something positive: their size is really good, a bit larger than what I is average-size. But that very most important thing to me personally in a towel is the texture, and these are not to my liking. They were "slick" out of the package, and have only slightly improved after five washings. I like the kind of towel that if you dry it on the clothesline, it gets stiff. And alas, after five trips through the laundry room, they are also stating to show signs of fraying.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2015
Author: Rebecca
Title: Best Towels for the Price, read on
Body: The Pinzon Egyptian Towels appear to be well made, good quality towels.I normally pay a lot of money for bath towels as I like superior quality and towels that last.  I needed some new towels for my guest bathrooms and didn't want to spend a lot of money because we really don't have guests that often.  I like that the Pinzon Egyptian Cotton Towels are available in sets with the hand towels and washcloths.I purchased 8 sets of the towels for our guest bathrooms.  My expectations weren't that high.  When researching what towels to purchase, I normally look for high GSM (grams per square meter).  The higher the number, the more absorbent and heavier the towel is, which generally leads to a towel that will last longer.  I couldn't find anything in the description of these towels that told what the GSM is, so I went totally off the shipping weight.  One 6-piece set (2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, 2 washcloths) weighs 4.3 pounds, which is fairly high for towels in this price range.  In comparison, the Amazon Basics 6-piece set is a couple dollars cheaper, but only weighs 3.2 pounds.  The Utopia set is an 8-piece set (comes with 4 washcloths), cost 5 dollars more, yet only weighs 3.85 pounds.I was impressed with the quality of the towels when they arrived.  I washed the towels before putting them out with a cup of vinegar to remove the protective coating that the towel makers put on towels and to help seal in the color to reduce future fading.  The towels came out of the dryer nice and soft and fluffy.  They have the appearance of a much more expensive towel.Are there better towels out there?  Yes, but for more money.  In my opinion, these are the best towels you'll find for the current price on Amazon of $21.99 per set.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2015
Author: cira
Title: Unfinished Product...
Body: I had ordered these towels because the price was right and most of the reviews were positive. I'm not sure what inspired the good reviews. Fresh out of the box, every towel had loose threads. I attempted to tie off one of them hoping I could get away with using them, but the the threads pulled very easily. I could imagine if I chose to wash them that they would unravel in the dryer. The towels are nice and big, but the quality is awful. As for how the towels felt, I would say that target sells softer. I don't recommend wasting your money here.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017
Author: Julio Figueroa
Title: Soft but not absorbent
Body: Very soft towel, as described. However, they are not very absorbent.Softness - 10/10Absorbency - 4.5/10

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2018
Author: EE_N_Avid_DIY
Title: Nice and fluffy and soft for a comparable price to ones that aren't quite as nice
Body: I have purchased a couple of bath towel sets in this product line and color. I plan to purchase more in a different color for another bathroom because these are great. Nice and fluffy and soft for a comparable price to ones that aren't quite as nice in walk in stores. Plus I avoid the store 😀Just be sure to wash and dry before use. They aren't as bad as others for having left over fluff but you definitely don't want to use them straight out of the shipping box. I haven't noticed any quality issues and we have had the first set over a year.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2018
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great towels!
Body: I really like these towels! I was hesitant since some of the more recent reviews mention a lot of lint when toweling off, the seams unraveling, etc. But I just bought a new shower curtain and needed maroon towels to match it, so I decided to take the risk.I obviously washed them before using them, and yes, definitely a lot of lint in the lint catcher. However, not a huge deal to me if it lints when being dried. That’s what it’s  supposed to do, after all. I even washed it with white socks I didn’t care about to see if it would bleed but they didn’t bleed at all.Used them today after my shower and they were great! The washcloth is probably a bit bigger than necessary, but the towel worked great! Love how big it is — I’m short, granted, but it covered me from armpit to knee, and wrapped around me fully with plenty of towel left over. I use one towel for just my hair, and it absorbed great, though a bit tougher to do the towel turban because of the size of the towel.Four stars because I’ve not had them long enough to attest to durability, but really happy with the purchase so far!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2018
Author: Melissa Davis
Title: I will never leave a bad review due to user error...
Body: 4 stars instead of 5 because they do shed a lot of lint, and there has been some straggling leftover lint when drying off. Otherwise, great towels for the price.Color fading issues: check your toiletries. Chances are they have chemicals in them that discolor fabrics. Benzoyl peroxide is one of the biggest culprits of this, which is found in face washes, astringents, and even body washes. By the way, this is such a wide-spread (regardless of quality) issue that there are towels made that are benzoyl peroxide-resistant. Whitening toothpastes do as well, as do mineral deposits in hard water.I don't know why so many people fly off the handle and leave a bad review without doing a minimal amount of research. I also don't know what some people are doing to their towels to have such damage to them after a couple of washes (holes in the middle of your towels? Seriously?). I do feel, though, that a lot of issues that people are complaining about are user errors - especially the discoloration. Check the products you use - if they have bleaching or whitening agents, or otherwise react negatively to colored fabrics - maybe get white towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2017
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Thin and rough - don’t buy
Body: Thin and not soft. Definitely wouldn’t recommend and I don’t think I’m that picky about towels. Planned to return them but over $9 for shipping (or dropping off at an Amazon locker) so will just have them guest towels that won’t be used often. Disappointed it’s that expensive to return and will definitely think twice before ordering something when returning is almost half the cost of the product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2015
Author: C R Schwarz
Title: If you're skeptical, read this
Body: These towels are great, nice large size, fluffy and soft. I only ordered one pack due to the mixed reviews and I wanted to try them before ordering several. As soon as they arrived I opened the package and felt the material. I wasn't very optimistic, as I had the poor reviews in mind, they felt rough and yes as others said, like public pool towels. Thankfully, I continued with my trial, and put them through the wash- alone because new towels produce a ton of lint. Yes one towel ended up with one minor thread pull. As an aside, I've never had a new towel go through the wash and not have at least one thread pull. I'd be willing to bet that the reviewers whose towels shredded in the wash were either not this thread count, brand etc, or perhaps their washer was malfunctioning. I put them through the dryer three times, again alone due to lint factor, and cleaning the lint filter in between each dryer cycle and noted the first cycle it was nearly full, and each subsequent cycle produced less lint until the third produced barely any. They came out of the dryer soft, fluffy, sturdy and overall very pleasing. I used them to dry myself after my very next shower and again, they were very absorbant, which again makes me question if those reviewers who said they didn't absorb well were reviewing the wrong item in some way or maybe they didn't wash them first. There was also absolutely no transfer lint etc the towels were super soft and large wrapping my average height (7 months pregnant) body from chest to knees with plenty of room to spare. With these towels passing the test, I went ahead and ordered more, and gave them all the same treatment with the same results. The only thing I can't make a representation on is colorfastness because I ordered white, but I highly recommend them just the same.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2013
Author: Annie
Title: Never Again
Body: I had read the reviews of these towels and should have heeded the warnings. They were not going to get heavy usage and I decided to place the order. These towels looked and felt good on arrival. I was hopeful. They have been washed only about three times and they are almost unusable due to the unraveling of the edges. I would not recommend purchasing these towels. I find it hard to believe that Amazon would put their name on such an inferior product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2019
Author: Dale Wickum
Title: Cheap product not even close to what Egyptian cotton it's supposed to represent.
Body: When I looked at purchasing a set of bath towels for my bathroom for showering I looked and research to see which type of material is best to absorb water and quick-drying and non fading and it came up with Egyptian cotton. That's it led me to this product here and I found out after the 30-day. To return it because I only wash maybe once every 3 weeks and I wash these towels may be four to five times that the color on the edges have turned from Brown to orange or red so they're changing color and 2 they did not absorb water around the sink as when you put the towel down on the sink the wipe it up it pushes it and it doesn't absorb it and 3 when you use it to dry off you have to rub yourself over and over to get it to absorb water and then if you don't stick it up high up towards the ceiling where it's warmer it won't dry out in a 24-hour. If you put it down at about a five to six foot level and hang it.I would not recommend buying this product bases with a state because I don't believe this is true Egyptian cotton bass is all the information that I researched on and I'm very disappointed because I got no assistance or really caring about it and I bought three sets of these and it just wasn't a good deal because now I've got three sets at nothing so I use them for grease rags and I'll find a true company that handles Egyptian cotton towels.UPDATE: April 8 2019I've attached a picture also of the fadingof the product and this is not a quality towel as in my 60 years of being alive I've never seen a towel not absorb water.Also they turned a different color around the edges or throughout the towels like this one did and I'm showing but just one towel out of three sets of towels that I purchased for $75 total and I got a $25 credit is all and they're continuing selling these towels and I've also attached one photo to show that label as it only is 30% Egyptian cotton not one-hundred-percent so beware of buying a product like this that is not what I researched again and found out what Egyptian cotton can do.Nowadays with the majority of everything they're putting non quality and harmful ingredients are products in two items they're selling to the consumer that's very harmful and that's sad because they're doing that to everything this day and age.check everything out and if you can't find it under the description ask the seller or manufacturer and that's what I've been doing now because a lot of items don't give you the total picture all I want is a sale and the money for their back profit they don't care about somebody's personal welfare or help anymore it's repeat business.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2015
Author: Peter Daniels
Title: A good price, a poor product
Body: I would not recommend this product. On the first wash it will run whatever color you bought and when you dry it in a dryer the lint from the towel is overwhelming - a whole lot. A good price but a poor quality product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2018
Author: racehorse6
Title: Nice towels
Body: I like these towels a lot, especially for the price. I've had no issues with them falling apart or turning weird colors. I have the same towels in gray as well, and no issues there either. The Driftwood color is a bit on the yellow end of the beige spectrum. It looks more pale beige in the product description but you can see from my photos how much brighter it is in person. Not a deal breaker for me, just worth noting.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2014
Author: Laura
Title: DISASTER! Worse than Walmart!  Shreds on first wash!
Body: Disaster!! Oh my gosh what a joke! If you need towels to wash your car with, here you go! Ok so they look fine and normal in the package. You remove it and wash it in mild water, mild soap, without any zippers or hooks in the load… BRAND NEW FIRST WASH from the package, it comes out all faded and SNAGGED!!! Snags on the first wash! All these threads popped out! What a joke! I bought the green one! If your a poor bachelor, and don't care about your home, company, impressing anyone, high standards, and have no taste, don't care about anything but a dry but, and live in a hovel, here you go!  I returned ALL of them immediately, and I had bought four sets all hopeful on the price. SAD SAD SAD how low our standards have become. These should be rags to wash your floor with. NASTY!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2016
Author: B.A.
Title: Buy cautiously. They start out beautiful but don't stay that way.
Body: I wanted these towels so badly. My peacock themed bathroom was not going to be complete without them. I bought two sets. When they arrived, they were perfect. After a few washes they began to fade, faster than any towel or linen I have ever owned, and after a month they began to unravel. These are good showroom towels, for a bathroom that won't be used, but not good towels to be used regularly or on a semi-regular basis. I will post a picture of a washcloth, may be used and washed once a week, with this review. Buy cautiously. They are beautiful but don't stay that way.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2015
Author: EGS
Title: Lots of loose threads; Dye on towels transferred to other towels
Body: I just received these towels. Right out of the box, threads were hanging on all of them. I then put them in the wash, and more threads started to appear. To top it off, the dye on the towels transferred to my other dark towels. This purchase just became a lot more expensive.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2016
Author: Jas
Title: If Your Drier Smells like Fire, It's Probably Caught A Lint Fire
Body: Holy moly! These towels come at a great price but the amount of LINT these babies shed is ridiculous!! I bought these in grey and white to match my bathroom color scheme and every time I wash them I have to clean out the lint catch twice per dry because there are HANDFULS of lint that come off of it! Can you say drier fire?? Not only that but when I dry myself off I'm still blanketed in lint all over my body. Wont be buying these again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2015
Author: Earthling1984
Title: Falling Apart
Body: Falling apart and I haven't even washed them yet...  These are HORRIBLE.  I don't know how they have such high reviews.  Maybe they used to be good but now are made by someone else.  The ones I got look fine, I have only used one so far, to dry off from 2 showers.  Not washed either yet.  And I noticed on the one I was using it was starting to fray, and not just one fray, I started noticing it all over all around the edges!  I then went and looked at my new, never used one, and found it also had tons of fray points, waiting to fall apart!  Do not get these!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2014
Author: Cen Cal Reviewer
Title: Terrible, terrible towels, and clearly NOT 725 GSM. The scale doesn't lie.
Body: These towels are possibly the worst purchase I've ever made from Amazon -- and I've been a frequent customer since the days when all they sold were books.I bought FOUR sets of these awful towels, to replace four 6-piece sets of Lands End's Supima bath towels. The Lands End towels are okay, but I've had them for three years and they're a bit tired out. I was hoping to replace them with a slightly beefier towel.Here's why I bought these Pinzon towels from Amazon:1. They were advertised as being the same size as the Lands End towels. Indeed this is true. Both bath towels, for example, are 56 by 30.2. They were advertised as being a heavier weight than the Lands End towels. The Lands End towels are okay, at 650 GSM, but these were advertised as a somewhat beefier 725 GSM. NOT TRUE.How do I know it's not true? Because when I received the towels, I was a bit disappointed. "Hm, I thought, they look and feel a bit thin. Perhaps they'll beef up in the wash. After all, Amazon says they are 725 GSM." No, they did not beef up in the wash.So, I weighed one of my OLD Lands End 650 GSM 56x30 bath towels, and one of the NEW Amazon 725 GSM 56x30 bath towels. If Amazon's advertising is correct, their towel by definition MUST weigh more. In fact, a 56x30 bath towel is roughly a square meter. (A square meter = 1550 square inches, and a 56x30 towel is 1680 square inches, or 1.08 square meters.) My brand new towel, in other words, should have weighed about 81 grams more (75 grams x 1.08), or nearly 3 ounces more, than my tired old Lands End towel. And in fact, when you consider how much dryer lint I've cleaned over three years of washing the old towels, the difference should probably be even more than that.But did my brand new Amazon towel weigh 3 ounces more? NO. It weighed about half an ounce less. So it's more like a 600 GSM towel -- or less. Not cool, Amazon.3. The set was $19.99 versus about $37 (on sale) for a Lands End set. I guess you get what you pay for. Now see, I guess everyone knows that. However, I asked myself, "How bad can a 725 GSM towel be? That's pretty beefy." Too bad the advertisement is completely false and they didn't send me 725 GSM towels.So, in other words, my problem is not that the $19 towels turned out to be pieces of crap. My problem is that they were not 725 gram towels, so the ad was completely misleading.Also, after that first wash, there were runs in some of the towels, and strings everywhere. CHEAP HORRIBLE TOWELS. In fact, I took a sample picture to show you, but I'm not seeing a place to upload it.Don't make the same horrible mistake. I feel very ripped off.Amazon: Please stop calling these 725-gram towels, because they aren't. Please label them correctly. I never would have bought 500 or 600 GSM towels, or whatever these are.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2016
Author: Shannon Woodside
Title: Please don't ignore the warnings. You get what you pay for.
Body: I thought the good reviews outweighed the bad and purchased these towels. I mistakenly thought that since my washing machine had an impeller instead of an agitator that the towels would be safe from shredding, but that wasn't the case. My towels began shredding about 2 months ago, about 3 months after purchase, and I've thrown almost all of them away.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2015
Author: Brett G. Thibault
Title: Poor Textiles
Body: These towels came apart at the edge; the first time I washed them, the bath towels both had long threads separated along the long side.  The hand towels did the same thing after 3 washes.  The absorbent part of the towels started to fray after 5 washes.  The color began to mottle and fade after 10 washes.  I wash on the light, short cycle with liquid detergent per the manufacturer's instructions.  I do not use bleach, color safe or otherwise, or any other additives.  These towels are less than two months old, and JC Penney towels I've had for more than 30 years look better.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
Author: Tracie_Renee
Title: Good towels for the price.
Body: I have used a set of their bathmats for the last four years and they have proven to be indestructible, so I was confident that the bath towel sets would be the same.  They are not at all fluffy when they arrive, but lets face it....they've been flattened and sealed in a package.  Upon washing (important note:...the instructions say to wash on LOW heat....this is different from the way I've washed towels for years and I would assume that not doing that might wear out your towel faster), I noticed a fair amount of lint.  This is normal and I expect this to go away after about four washings.  They are now fairly fluffy.  I say fairly because they are not "THE" fluffiest towel I've owned.  But I didn't want that much fluff.  I have had super fluffy towels and while they feel nice, they are a PITA to wash, dry and hang because of the fluffiness.  I bought these to spite the negative reviews, noting that some people didn't wash according to instructions, and some people want different things out of a towel.  For the price, I was willing to risk that the 57% of five star ratings were correct.  I bought the Navy and the dark Brown, and their color was as advertised.  No bleeding, no fraying, no damage.  The size is impressive.  I prefer large sized towels.  These hit their mark with that in not only the bath towel, but the hand towel as well.  I will come back after some use and update this review based on what I find after using them.  So far though, right out of the box they are better than what I would find in a department store and I didn't have to go out and get them!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2018
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: First impression not impressed at all with this product
Body: I received 2 bath towels 2 hand towels and two wash clothes. The color is Coco brown. Happy with the color.  What im disapointed in is that they are not at all fluffy and far from being soft. They remind me of an older towel that has been washed and dried many many many times that are no longer thick or fluffy that was my first impression of these towels.  They are not soft matter of fact they were kind of stiff.  If these were in an actual store were i could have touched them i would never had bought them.I will not buy this (Amazon) name brand again because of the low quality of the product

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017
Author: Merlo
Title: Innacurate color description (plumb is a light lilac)
Body: I ordered the plumb color towels as a fift but they are incorrectly labeled, towels are a light lilac. The person I gifted them to still liked the color but if it was me, Id return them.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2017
Author: DragonLo
Title: Five Stars
Body: These are very absorbent and dry quickly.  I will purchase more of this brand in the future.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2017
Author: Amber Vaden
Title: Love the towels and they are a good big size
Body: Love the towels and they are a good big size

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2017
Author: Paul E. Murphy
Title: Soft but not too absorbent
Body: They are soft, but not too absorbent - ok for the price but I am looking for more absorbent for quick drying

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2013
Author: Pamela F
Title: Priced Well  - Needs Lots of Washing To Remove Lint
Body: These are very good for the price.  Pretty soft and I'd call them heavyweight.  I really love the plum color.The one note I'd give is wash, wash, wash and dry dry dry and remember not to use a dryer sheet or fabric softener or you won't be happy with the absorbency. I took another reviewer's advice and ran these through with some vinegar, then washed as usual (without softener).  The amount of lint is A LOT, so be aware of that.  I've run these through 7 cycles now and while there is not as much build up in the dryer screen, I still get a few fuzzies on my hands from the hand towels, but the bath towels seem to be done 'shedding' -  overall, I'm happy with my purchase - But Again - be patient - the pay off is a nice set of towels at a very good price.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2015
Author: jim jeffery
Title: Junk!
Body: These things are just plain junk.  They leave blue (that's the color I ordered) balls all over the bathroom and me.  I've tried washing them a half of dozen times and they still keep leaving the balls.  I haven't even left any comment on how badly the lint screen in the drier is plugged.  Advice save your money and then buy a quality product.  These are not any were close to being quality!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2016
Author: JoeyBishop
Title: They are wonderful. The color is vibrant
Body: I have read a lot of reviews on these towels and I completely disagree with those that complain about them. They are wonderful. The color is vibrant, and it lasts wash after wash. I bought them some time ago and waited to see how they would hold up and they have been great. They are not skinny skimpy towels but rather full and lush. I have not had any problem with shedding as at least one reviewer claimed. Perhaps they didn't wash them before using? I would heartily recommend them and I will purchase them again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2015
Author: MB
Title: Color Faded Immediately!
Body: Not worth the investment. The color faded from my towels after 3 regular washes.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
Author: Happy Amazoner
Title: Liked them so much I bought a second set
Body: I already have a set of these towels, so I bought a second set based on how much I like them. When I looked it up, I was surprised to see that my other ones were 3 years old, as they still look and feel like new. They are the wedge wood color, and they have not faded at all. I do put A&H washing soda ( not baking soda), in the wash every time, and it keeps towels from having odors, and maybe helps keep the colors bright too. When I washed the new moss colored towels, they did not fade, and they are nice and soft. Very happy with Pinzon towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019
Author: ceedreamer
Title: Amazon brand, Pinzon
Body: I am the type of person, that once I purchase something and it worked for myself and my husband, I never, or rarely deviated from that product. Shopping for new towels after many, many years, the only shade of a color  I was searching for,  came up in the Pinzon line, which is the Amazon brand. Thought about ordering the towels that looked a shade or two off, as they were the name brands we had always purchased, when one of the big mall stores had a sale. It is difficult for both of us to go shopping at stores and malls as my better half has health problems, and I have become totally disabled. So, just going out to shop, is in our past. I have kept the household and us, running smoothly by shopping at Anazon, thus far. But this nagging feeling I had about changing the richness of the color scheme we have set ourselves up for in a bathroom that was redone,  in preparation for the last time in our lives, to redecorate had me worried. They LOOKED nice and fluffy, and MOST towels are very absorbent. But I have also seen towels in store advertisements that, once in the store, the product looks and feels, NOT as advertised. At times, it resembled nothing like the pictures and descriptions. So, after discussing it with my other half, we decided to "take a leap", for once and  go with Pinzon, Amazon's brand. I admit I worried about authenticity of both color and quality many times, as I awaited the delivery. Oh my! When they came, was I surprized! Not only did they all match perfectly, the QUALITY was beyond my expectations! They are thick, beautiful towels that are fluffy, wash beautifully and are so soft! On top of that, the color scheme matched perfectly! My other half even remarked about these towels, and he rarely says anything about a product,  unless he does not like it. So THAT in itself was a bonus. I have always opted for the "other" brand when choosing what to purchase on Amazon. After this experience, I will be ordering Pinzon towels for another bathroom, once we are done  re-doing things like paint and flooring. They happen to have another shade of a color, that will match another bath perfectly. From now on, I won't  be as rigid as to my choices of what we have liked and worked for us before. Amazon REALLY surprised me, in that not only did they come out with their own line of merchandise, but thus far it exceeded my expectations for quality! I have been "sold"!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019
Author: Candice Dahl
Title: Very durable
Body: Here's a picture of a new towel, fresh out of the box, and the same towel purchased 2-5 years ago with extensive wear. Can't tell the difference? I can't either! These towels are awesome!Okay, maybe there are a few differences......a few threads have come lose, but none of the major ones that hold it together. No frayed ends or anything. Extremely durable. The texture has stayed the same, and they're still soft. Color has stayed the same, even in very hot water. No issues with color running, either. 10/10, would buy again (and did).

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2014
Author: Craig D.
Title: Hit & Miss
Body: This is the second set I've purchased. The first one was light brown. It had a lot of threads pulling out to begin with. Once I cut them off, it seems to be OK. This blue set didn't have as many threads of the pile coming out, but it had a lot of stitching threads that needed to be trimmed off (and a few pile threads). This one also seemed to have a lot of pith balls on it, even after the first washing. Overall, the quality seems to be pretty good as far as density. Only time will tell how well it holds up.UPDATE:After four months, one of the towels developed a hole in the middle; not a tear, but a hole. It seems the woven fabric just came apart. I have bought other cheaper towels that held up more than 10 years before the edges started to fray. We are not hard on towels. The worst part is that once you are past the 30-day window for returns, THERE IS NO WARRANTY. There is absolutely no method of correction (unless you consider this review a "correction"). I have not YET had any problems with the other towels, but is it just a matter of time? Unless you're willing to risk simply throwing your money away, I do NOT recommend these towels from Amazon. Another seller who stands behind their product (beyond 30 days) would be OK, but NOT from AMAZON!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2018
Author: chris
Title: Zero problems and only a very small ball of lint ...
Body: Zero problems and only a very small ball of lint and it was from the entire set in one wash. The problem here folks is that people don't own up to their mistakes and don't know how to follow laundry instructions on labels. Also stop using fabric softener folks, it seriously toxic ! Do research on it, its seriously harmful and it damages your clothes/linens etc.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2014
Author: Claude
Title: This color doesn't dry and peels.
Body: We own this set of towels in Dark brown, lavender, purple, and moss.Strangely enough, the quality control varies tremendously, and can be extremely defective.I give five stars to the dark brown, Moss and lavender towels, which are thick and extremely absorbent.I give one star to the purple and driftwood towels which are very light, not absorbent, peel and have threads coming out of them.  One thing you should also know is  that the purple color leaks during a hot wash.Limited to my purchases of five sets, I still do recommend  those I give five stars to, but not the colors I give only one star.Update: The color *Moss* doesn't dry dry and peels too.  So like the others in this category, it receives only one star.  I'm going to return the three sets to Amazon.  I am stunned by the poor quality of these towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2015
Author: L. Danek
Title: So disappointed!
Body: 1- My husband didn't like these towels because he said they didn't really absorb the water. I told him to give them some time to break in. It's been approx. 2-3 months. He is still displeased, and I cannot say he is wrong.2- I ordered these towels in gray, and they are already discoloring!! They will be going into the pile for "washing the dog" and "mopping the floor" due to the orange/rust-colored marks on them!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2015
Author: inspectorrick
Title: Nice Towels, but color defect!
Body: It arrived in a Beautiful Wrapping and container, and although the color was darker than shown, we liked the Quality of Egyptian Cotton, and the price, so we wanted to keep them.  The first thing I did was to wash them, by themselves, in cold water (as we always do) with nothing but Regular Tide Detergent, (no additives) and I dried them on the Low Temp, 30 Minute Cycle, by themselves again, and noticed what I thought was a bit of Red Color in the one Big Towel.  I hung them up, and took pictures of it, and compared it to the rest of the set, but just the one towel is showing this color defect so far.  Because as I said of the price, and the Hopeful Good Quality, we are going to keep them since it's in the Back Bathroom.  But had this been for the Guest Bathrooms, I probably would have returned them, and went for a Higher Quality (hopefully Color-fast Set)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2014
Author: Tom
Title: A bit disappointed with this purchase.
Body: We have had the same experience as many here. Even after several washings: Lint. Lint. Lint.They leave lint in the shower. On the floor. In the hamper. My wife has gone back to using the old towels they were meant to replace. When I dry off after a shower, my wife has to help me pick lint off of my face (it likes to stick to the beard stubble).  It also bleeds a bit of color when damp though less now than when brand new.For the price they are not horrible. But I'd not buy them again. I'll keep my money.  They can keep their lint.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2013
Author: mwcox35
Title: After 2 years, still holding up
Body: I purchased these towels a month after getting married. Almost 3 years into the marriage and many, many washes, they have held up extremely well. I think any towel, hand towel, or washcloth is going to develop the string issue when you wash it. That is the nature of terry. However, we have used and abused these towels, washing them in hot water on every load and with bleach and they are still in one piece. The washcloths are beginning to fall apart, but I have had the same issue with every one I have ever used no matter what brand and how much I pay for them and no matter what store. My husband is 6'4 and the towels are perfect size for him. I am 5'5 and they are almost too large and heavy to wrap my hair in when I get out of the shower, but I say this in a good way. The material is very thick, well made, worth the investment and I am about to purchase several more sets to replace all my kids towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2017
Author: Doris Sorrells
Title: Five Stars
Body: Best towels ever i have bought sets of two colors heavey very classly these towel are very large covers whole rap around body , hand towels would almost wrap wet hair on your head and wash clothes are large too . Great price for what you get .Doris Sorrells Ga

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2015
Author: Wen
Title: Good mid weight towels but linty...
Body: I purchased this line of towels in the Moss and Wedgwood colors. Researched "washing new towels" and ended up washing them in warm water with detergent and white vinegar then detergent and baking soda. This is supposed to set the color and accelerate removing the coating that is put on new towels (which interferes with absorbency). I did this 4 times (drying in dryer after each wash). This process did seem to get rid of the coating and lint faster. BUT, the difference in the amount of lint generated by the moss set and the Wedgwood set was tremendous! The moss set shed barely a handful of lint thru the process but the Wedgwood set shed at least 6-7 large handfuls of lint ! (I also bought a Pinzon 550 GSM set in coral and had the same lint nightmare!).What I like: The colors! Which match the pics pretty closely.  The banding does not shrink.  They are soft and absorbent (after the washings).  Good quality mid weight towel.What I don't like: Lint!! Don't understand how in the world Amazon can say their towels won't shed much after the first wash.  The coating put on the towels.  One of the Wedgwood hand towels came apart at the side seam after first wash.  The corner of one of the Moss bath towels was not sewn down completely.Overall: I like these mid weight towels, would purchase again and think they are priced right.I suggest Amazon should include instructions for the initial washing process of their towels (with the vinegar, wash/dry frequency, etc.). Customers would have a more favorable view of their towels if they had a more positive, quick, and less annoying experience with getting rid of the lint and increasing the towels' absorbency.But what I REALLY wish is that some brilliant Research & Development person will think to market towels that are sold without a coating and already defuzzed!! I would buy them......And I would cuss less......

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2017
Author: Heather W
Title: Great towels
Body: Nice size, great "fluff" factor.  These have done well through several washes now, and don't shed threads.  For the price, these are wonderful.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
Author: D.G. Tagtmeier
Title: Disappointing
Body: When we received these towels we thought we had gotten a good deal, but after 3 washings they look weathered, and are coming unthreaded.  I'm sure we will be throwing these out way sooner than we thought we would.  It's back to Big Lots time.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019
Author: Adam
Title: misleading information, its INDIAN TOWLES, Very Disappointing
Body: I was so excited to order egyptian cotton towels. Being an Egyptian myself, when I recieved the towels it was 30% Egyptian cotton and 70% regular cotton ! And on top of that, its MADE IN INDIA not in Egypt. Im very disappointed with the quality over all. Buyers please be aware!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2016
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: NOT Worth It At ANY Price
Body: These are terrible. Don't buy them, and here's why:They are rough (and I'm a freelancer barely scraping by month-to-month, so let's be honest... I was willing to settle for less... this is not worth its already low price)They leave TONS of lint. I have washed them several times now. Lint on EVERYTHING they were washed/dried with, and when I dry my hands or after a shower, just lint all over me. Not a piece or two. Hundreds.They're cheap, but you can spend your money elsewhere. Towels at Target I've found to be very affordable and of totally decent quality. Find the equivalent online or go to your nearest store, if price is your first concern.AVOID THESE.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2013
Author: James Duke
Title: Love them, but still linting and bleeding dye.
Body: These are the most comfortable towels I've had in years, but I'm more than slightly annoyed that after nearly ten washes they are still bleeding dye (a tiny bit, but still - I can't wash them with anything except my brown towels) and linting everywhere, constantly (they still turn the entire lint tray red in my dryer). After so many washes, and in only cold water at that, you would think they would have stopped dropping loose little balls of fuzz, but apparently not.Complaints aside, these are ridiculously soft. I use them almost daily, and they haven't lost their softness. I really only use the large towels; the washrags are useless for scrubbing in the shower because they're so soft, and the handtowels usually end up being bath pillows. so my neck isn't against the back of the tub.I don't regret buying them, but they could definitely be better.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2014
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I do not recommend.
Body: We did not like much this product since cotton falls from the towel. We had to first wash prior using it. The washing machine was full of cotton, all green. So we had a big work to clean all the wash machine. After first using the towel, it was my turn to be all green, full of cotton, I looked like a green dog, with cotton all over my body. Then I had to clean my bathroom, cause there were cotton all over the floor. I really do not recommend.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2016
Author: RavenSEAL
Title: Disastrous amounts of lint.
Body: As good-looking and functional as these towels are, they shed everywhere. Literally. I've found red lint in my living room, in my bedroom, while dusting furniture. I've found red lint in my closet, and even at work on my desk. I've even had red lint accumulate in the shower, because it sheds all over my body and washes off the next day. I wish I could send these back for a refund yesterday.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2017
Author: Legalredhead42
Title: Horrible quality!
Body: Bought three sets of these.  Every single one unraveled and fell apart after two washings, but because I didn't use them until a couple months after purchase, it was too late to return them.  Only posting this review as a warning to others.  The are junk.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2017
Author: KWACK12
Title: Very Soft Towels
Body: These towels are true to the color shown, are very plush and soft, and after one wash, they had hardly any lint. I only gave these 4 stars because while they work just fine, they aren't very absorbent. They do the job just fine, but I expected more from the way the towels felt.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2016
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Color Me Dissappointed
Body: When we opened and washed these, they looked and felt great. After just one use, the hand towel was badly discolored - it went from grey to a peachy, bleached-out color. My bath towel followed suit, while my husband's towel is still fine. The only thing that I can think of that I use differently is a face wash for normal to oily skin. It is not prescription and I didn't think that it was that harsh. This has not happened with any other towels that we have used through the years. I was excited for these towels, but this has been a disappointing experience.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
Author: Karma
Title: I waited WAY TOO LONG!!
Body: I don't buy tissues unless someone has a cold, cause grabbing a toilet roll just feels more "frugal".  And we don't buy new towels unless we have company coming for a visit.  Apparently we haven't had over night guests in a while.  I didn't even realize how BAD my old towels were until we got these.  Oh my goodness!  I had to laugh.  My husband suggested we buy the cranberry set so that they wouldn't get mixed up in the laundry with anyone else's towels in our multigen home.  LOL.  We love them, we do.  I need to buy more.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019
Author: 🦄 Summer of '75 ☀️
Title: Washing makes a HUGE difference!
Body: When I received these towels I was a little disappointed because they were stiff and had a little bit of a while film on them almost as if they were a bit faded. I decided to keep them even though they didn't at first seem like what I  wanted.  I thought I could always use them as back ups or something.  So I washed them and boy was I surprised! They came out of the dryer fluffy and vibrant,  I was so happy :)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2015
Author: Objective Subjective
Title: Disappointed with the current sets
Body: Two years ago when we first ordered these, we thought of them as a best buy and a great value, as they were thick and thirsty and soft. Far better than towels at the major department stores that sold for twice as much at their so-called 50% Off sales. So, we ordered several more sets recently. We are very disappointed with the current sets from Pinzon. From the start and even after five washings, these new ones have not "thickened" and they are not at all "thirsty". They still soft, but softness alone doesn't cut it if you need more than one bath towel to dry yourself after a shower. Softness alone doesn't cut it if the hand towel feels "wet" after one use. So, 3 stars because at this price, they are just "OK". I would have to say these are now only as good as the low-end department store towels which sell for 4.99/3.99/2.99 (bath/hand/finger) when they are 50%off. Add that up and you get the Amazon price. We won't be buying these again. By the way, we have noticed many reviews which claim these towels shed too much and unravel easily. In both our old sets and these new ones, this has not happened. Face it, any new towel is going to create a lot of lint in your dryer for the first 2 or even 3 washings, but after that lint production is minimal.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2013
Author: Katy Lake
Title: Good towels if you can be patient
Body: I've been dying to get these plum towels for awhile, but I just couldn't justify getting yet another towel set. When I was revamping one of the bathrooms, I finally decided to take the plunge, despite all the warnings about how these towels shed.First of all, the color really is true to what you see here. The other thing I'd notice is that the towels seem very thin. I was initially disappointed, but I knew I'd wash them first before I used them.Well, I can honestly say that anyone who says they shed is not pulling your leg. Whoa! A ton of lint in the washer lint trap and another ton in the dryer trap! I wondered if there'd be any towels left after all the lint was gone.I used the towels, which were a big meh. Thin and lots of lint. But what's interesting is that after a few washes and dryings, the towels seem to have plumped up.I was just folding the bath towel downstairs, and damn, it really was nice and full and fluffy. All the towels in the set got a lot nicer the more I washed and dried them.The lint is less but still prodigious in the dryer. The color has stayed true. The towels are very roomy and haven't shrunk.I know that different colors in towels react different ways, and who knows? Maybe I got in on a good lot and newer ones won't react as well.But I'd say for $20, it was a good investment - they are pretty, absorbent, and plump towels. So try a few washes and dryings before you make up your mind. You might be pleasantly surprised.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2013
Author: MK van Bronkhorst
Title: If I didn't need guest towels in a hurry, I would have skipped this
Body: Company is coming and I need a set of guest towels to replace the ones that got in the way of a falling bleach bottle. The price was extremely reasonable for this towel set. However, if I'd taken the time to read the reviews, I would have seen that "you get what you pay for" is quite true in this case.I ordered two sets and immediately opened and washed the first. The bottom of the washer was coated with a thin layer of maroon threads and tufts, and both the towels and washcloths were visibly shedding threads when they came out to go to the dryer. They came out of the dryer nice and fluffy, but the towel and face cloth edges were frayed and shedding more threads and tufts. I trimmed them the best I could and will use them for utility and daily wear (where guests won't see them).Bottom Line: Skip these, even though the picture is pretty, unless you know you'll have an hour to trim away the fluff, threads and shedding bits before Aunt Sally rings the doorbell.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2015
Author: PJ Arts
Title: Hotel-grade towels on the cheap! Soft, heavy and thirsty
Body: I'm a divorced guy who lives alone, and I tend to buy things for myself that are 'good enough'...including towel sets (Walmart, Target, etc.).Despite the 'Egyptian Cotton' claims, I really purchased these towels because it was a lot less expensive than buying a full set at a discount store.Imagine my surprise, when the product turned out to be a hotel quality set of towels...and, I should know: after 3 decades as a salesman, I have stayed at a LOT of hotels. These are thick, soft, heavy and thirsty towels that look really nice on the towel bar; and, feel fantastic when you step out of the shower.I know some reviewers have complained that their sets have not held up well. All I can tell you is that I wash mine in hot water, with an Arm & Hammer laundry detergent packet, and a scoop of Oxi-Clean. After 8 washings, they are perfect: no pilling, shredding, fading...nothing bad.I am planning on getting another set, and would recommend these to anyone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2016
Author: Linda D. Dadona
Title: I purchased these last year as a Christmas gift for ...
Body: I purchased these last year as a Christmas gift for my son and his family.  I bought two sets.  After a few months white spots began to appear as if bleach had dropped on them but they do not use bleach or bleach based products in their home.  When I looked into returning the defective towels, I discovered that the time to return an item had expired.  If I had purchased them physically in a store that would not have been the case.  There should be a way to address defects that occur after the 30 day initial return period.  I will not be buying towels etc on Amazon again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2018
Author: Kim
Title: PInzon Plum Towels
Body: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B007K6SOTQ/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0I spent maybe an hour and a half going through product reviews for several different towel brands on Amazon, target, Bed Bath and Beyond etc. I settled on these based on the color and the relatively positive reviews. I really wanted nice purple towels that would match my bathroom, and these delivered on that. The towels came in the complete 6-piece set - nicely packaged and undamaged. The color is not as deep as it's shown in the picture - to some it might seem faded, but I'm content with the color. They aren't like super fluffy soft or thick, so that's a let down.I washed them before using according to the label - hot water and tumble dry low. I did it on a speed wash cycle and low spin though, since it was the first wash. They came out from the dryer a little softer than before. No tears or loose threads. Not as much lint as I thought there would be and the color didn't fade from their original condition. I haven't seen any fuzzies after getting them damp from using them post-shower/post-hand washing. They dry pretty quickly just by being hung. I don't think I'll risk washing them with other clothes, but that's my personal preference. All in all, I'm pretty satisfied with the set!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2013
Author: Linda Makofski
Title: Pinzon Basics/Pike Street Egyptian Towel Set
Body: I'm so disappointed.  I changed colors in both bathrooms.  The towels I had been using were Pike Street and they were great. I've purchased Pike Street Egyptian Cotton bedding and blankets.  Every time I've purchased Pike Street I've been more than happy with my purchases.  Because of my past record with Pike Street I was sure I wouldn't go wrong.  The towels DON'T ABSORB.  After I dry off with one of these towels I have to either find another towel to finish the job or use my hair blow dryer over my entire body.  I'm shocked.  I packed up all my green, blue and pink Pike Street towels and gave them to the Red Cross. Now I am frustrated every time I shower or wash my hands.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2017
Author: Nik F.
Title: Cheap, lightweight least colorfast material on the planet
Body: Cheap, lightweight least colorfast material on the planet.  Absolute garbage. Why, Amazon?  Still in shock.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2017
Author: Ellie
Title: Lies!
Body: Very disappointed! These towels had raving reviews and description made them sound trustworthy. I haven’t washed them with bleach yet, but somehow strings have already come out throughout them. They didn’t even last 6 months! Ridiculous! Of course they start to come apart when return window closes. Would not recommend these towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
Author: Jillybean
Title: A year later. Want to buy 2 more sets, but don't need to.
Body: The towels are not too big or too heavy. They dry quickly when hung up. They wash and dry and come out soft and thirsty. These towel have held up for a year. No pilling, no strings, no unraveling edges. I have 2 sets that I exchange weekly. I am very happy with these towels.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2014
Author: zah
Title: do NOT buy the "Wedgewood" blue ones!
Body: These towels turned to s*** after one wash.  The threads started coming out and they lost a TON of lint in the dryer in each successive wash.  I returned them 2 weeks later (thanks Amazon).NOTE: These problems were only with the blue colour..  We have the identical towel set in white, ordered at the same time, and it's great.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2016
Author: Literatus
Title: Okay for price
Body: These towels appear to be seconds. Every one I received had pills. see the photos. I washed them upon delivery with 1 cup vinegar when they arrived - they have held color and have been absorbent upon exit from shower/bath.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2013
Author: Steve
Title: Worthless!
Body: These are not towels, they are large pieces of lint. Every time I used them, they left residue on my skin. And yes, I washed them, but that did not make a difference. If you refuse to heed my warning and buy them anyway, please only use them for decoration.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2013
Author: Nathan Groff
Title: Good product but...
Body: As stated by others, these towels shed a lot! I have had them over a week now and always wash them before use. I threw them in with everything else and everything came out covered in lint! I have washed the two sets I bought two times each and even kept them in the dryer to tumble with no heat to get a bit more lint off. I have used one of them and I like the towel, but the shedding is a bit crazy.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2015
Author: Emily Badillo
Title: Super soft, thick towels
Body: Super soft, thick towels. Great quality for a great price. The color is not quite as deep as pictured and didn't match exactly how I wanted...but that is my only complaint! More of a maroon color than cranberry..

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2015
Author: Average Consumer
Title: While they looked quite nice when they arrived
Body: DO NOT BUY!!! While they looked quite nice when they arrived, after the first use, the color came off leaving a mottled orange and brown towel.As it was over 30 days from purchase, I can not get a refund nor replacement. Total rip off!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
Author: TN Vball Girl
Title: Bring back the 2013 version!
Body: Bring back the original 2013 version of this product! I have been purchasing this exact item for 7 years now. My entire towel closet is made up of this brand! This 2020 version is NOT the same product. The originals are soft and very thick. This is paper thin and what I expect to get at the dollar store. I am very very disappointed in the item I received two weeks ago. :(  It even looks out of place in my closet. A marked difference in thickness!The only positive qualities are the size and getting two sets. At my age, I want what I want. And, I want softness, thickness, and size. This new version is 1 for 3. Therefore, I give the 2020 towel set 1 star. Bring back the 2013 version of this towel set!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
Author: Emma
Title: Extremely soft but sturdy; Wrap up like a burrito
Body: I'm always hesitant ordering towels off-line because of false advertising. I was not disappointed with these though. They are very soft but sturdy. After I washed them and went to use, I was waiting for something to start unraveling or getting fuzzies all over me. Again, that wasn't the case. These surprised me greatly!
